title: Field Application Engineer
description:
About TP-Link
  
Headquartered in the United States, TP-Link is a key player in the network products and solutions market. Ranked as the No.1 supplier of WLAN products, TP-Link distributes its service in more than 170 countries. We unveiled the World’s 1st complete WiFi 7 Networking Solution for Homes, Enterprises and ISP, showing the ambition to always bring the cutting-age technology to the market.
  
  

**Description of work tasks:**  

In the position as Field Application Engineer, the Employee will have the responsibility to
  
**1) Pre-sales:** Engage with ISP customers, optimize workshop content; deeply understand and accumulate ISP requirements; collect and track relevant tender info.
  
**2) Project delivery:** Responsible for the implementation and delivery of ISP projects.
  
**3) After-sales support:** Provide post-sales support for ISP projects, including debugging and software updates/iterations; act as the bridge with PMs and R&D colleagues.
  
  

**Description of qualifications:**  

1) Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
  
2) Strong knowledge of networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, routing, Wi-Fi, Ethernet).
  
3) Hands-on troubleshooting skills with Linux-based systems and test tools. 4) Strong communication skills and ability to work directly with customers, including travel to ISP sites as required.
  
  

**We offer:**  

TP-Link has no.1 market share in consumer networking and IPC categories. We continue to grow by expanding channel partners and portfolios. In return for your talent and effort, we pay a competitive salary and offer attractive benefits, which may include, but not limited to:
  
* Excellent platform to deep dive into Nordic consumer channel from various angles
* International working environment.
* Healthy work-life balance.
* Career opportunities.

title: Experienced Firmware Engineer – Fixed Dome Cameras, Lund
description:
Job Title
Experienced Firmware Engineer – Fixed Dome Cameras, Lund
Job Description*At Axis Communications, we're dedicated to creating a smarter and safer world! Join our team in developing innovative products and features using cutting-edge technologies. We're seeking an Experienced Firmware Engineer for our Fixed Dome Firmware team at our HQ in Lund, Sweden.*
Your Future Team
As a Firmware Engineer, you'll play a crucial role in developing our new network video products. You'll collaborate with various functions like Linux Platform software, image quality, mechanical design, electronics, and production test.
Our Fixed Dome Firmware team consists of both junior and senior engineers working in an agile and open environment. You'll take ownership of projects and share responsibility for meeting the delivery targets.
What you’ll do here as an Experienced Firmware Engineer?* Develop network video devices in our product development projects
* Configure and adopt AXIS OS, our Linux-based OS, for next-gen products
* Analyse, design, and write software for upcoming product features
* Solve complex problems in a large code base, from Linux kernel drivers to applications
* Optimise embedded system performance
* Contribute to improving our team's workflow
* Launch new competitive products and solutions


Who are we looking for?
We seek a team player who loves challenges, is curious, passionate about technology, and enjoys problem-solving in a team-focused atmosphere. You should have a personal drive and thrive in an environment of openness, creativity, trust, commitment, playfulness, and encouragement. You should also enjoy investigating and working with different kinds of problems in different areas of the code base.
We'd love to hear that you have/are:* An engineering bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, physics, mathematics, electrical engineering, or equivalent
* 5+ years of relevant work experience
* Linux system programming, user space, kernel space, and device drivers’ knowledge
* Experienced with C and/or C++ programming
* Familiar with agile methodologies


It's a bonus if you also have experience in/with:* Debug tools (GDB, Valgrind)
* Scripting (shell, Python, Perl)
* Low-level programming (Micro Controllers)
* Continuous integration, version control (Git), build tools
* Yocto
* Using AI tools (e.g. GitHub co-pilot) in your daily work


What Axis have to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today! In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Lotta Wennolf.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2026-01-30*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Product Imaging Engineer with interest in embedded development – Intercoms, Lund
description:
Job Title
Product Imaging Engineer with interest in embedded development – Intercoms, Lund
Job Description*The Intercom team at New Business R&D is looking for a new colleague. Could that be you?*
Who is your future team?
We're a collaborative group of engineers passionate about solving complex problems and driving innovation. We develop and maintain the firmware of the Intercom products in the Axis portfolio, which also includes ensuring a market leading camera solution. You will be collaborating with co-workers from different disciplines, such as mechanical design, electronics, software, production testing and of course with other imaging engineers.
What you’ll do here as Product Imaging Engineer?
You will work in our firmware development team, where your key responsibility is to ensure our developed intercom products are delivered with high image/video quality. The work is both hardware focused (e.g. choosing sensor and optics in an early stage of the development and possibly writing parts of sensor back-end), software focused (e.g. tuning the image pipeline), as well as focused on production (e.g. defining quality standards in terms of production test limits). In addition, you will sometimes have the possibility to do embedded development in other areas of our products (audio, RFID, etc.) to broaden your horizons.  

We focus on continuous learning and growth and allocate 10% of our time to exploring new ideas and improving our skills. Maybe you will be the one coming up with a cool new feature to our intercoms or a more efficient way of working?
Who are you?
We believe you are a team player who challenges the way we work to make sure we learn and improve. It will make us very happy if you have some experience in imaging, hopefully previous work experience or maybe a big personal interest in photography. While our Linux based platform supports other languages, such as C++, Rust and Go, most of our code is written in C, so we believe that this is your preferred language. At Axis, we put a lot of trust in the engineers, and you will be able to influence the outcome of a product greatly.
We'd love to hear that you have any combination of these skills:* Working knowledge of C and Embedded Linux.
* Experience with optical components such as optics, lenses, image sensors, IR filters and IR diodes.
* Knowledge of image processing algorithms.
* Experience in Git, Yocto/BitBake.
* Experience of Python.


What Axis have to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide. As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Some degree of PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) required (safety glasses, gowning, gloves, lab coat, ear plugs etc.)**Job Description**

**Job Description**


As our new Field Service Engineer, you will support customers across the Nordic region, delivering a full range of service activities — including installations, repairs, maintenance, validation, and technical support — for Unity Lab Services.  

You will primarily work with our Trace Elemental Spectrometry and Chrome product lines. (ICP-OES, ICP-MS, IC, and HPLC)


This is a field-based position, supporting customers throughout the Nordic countries. Candidates can be based anywhere within Norway or Sweden, provided you live near an international airport.


As part of the dedicated TEA Chrom Service team, you will participate in delivering market-leading on-site services that consistently exceed our customers’ expectations.

**Our Organisation**


This position sits within our Instrument and Enterprise Services (IES) organization — a single source for integrated lab services, support, and supply management. Our customized service offerings are designed with flexibility and expertise to meet each customer’s unique business needs.  

Whether providing maintenance for a single instrument or managing services across entire laboratories, we deliver tailored solutions that help our customers achieve their goals efficiently and effectively.

**What Will You Do?**

* Deliver professional fault finding, installation, preventive maintenance (PM), repair, and qualification services in a timely and customer oriented manner.
* Provide premier technical support.
* Actively promote service contracts and related products.
* Ensure customer satisfaction through clear communication, professionalism, and proactive problem-solving — bringing up critical issues swiftly when needed.
* Manage company assets effectively, including spare parts, tools, software, computer, phone, vehicle, and documentation.
* Coordinate your work schedule efficiently with internal scheduling teams for optimal service planning and dispatching.
* Submit timely and accurate reports, such as Field Service and Expense Reports.
* Collaborate with the Sales team to see opportunities, share customer insights, and support business growth.

**Who We Are Looking For**

* Educational background in Electronics, Chemistry, Engineering, or a related field.
* Hands-on experience with analytical instruments — gained as a Field Engineer, Application Specialist, Scientist, or Laboratory Technician.
* Working knowledge of ICP, ICP-MS, IC, or HPLC techniques is advantageous, but not essential.
* Proficient in English; additional Nordic languages are a plus.
* A valid driver’s license is required.
* Customer focused with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Highly self-motivated and capable of working independently with strong organizational abilities.
* Willing and able to travel regularly across the region (typically 4–5 days per week), including some overnight stays and extended trips for training — up to 50% travel annually.

**What’s in It for You**

* Outstanding opportunities for career development within a global, industry-leading organization.
* Comprehensive training and mentoring to support your technical and professional growth.
* Competitive salary and performance bonus, along with a full benefits package.
* Company car provided.

**About Us**


At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer.  

Join our global team of over 100,000 colleagues, united by a shared set of values and a passion for making a difference every day.  

Discover our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us — and help advance science for a better tomorrow.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Backend .NET
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 9 års erfarenhet inom aktuell roll
* Relevant utbildning inom IT/systemutveckling eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad genom yrkeserfarenhet
* Minst 10 års arbetserfarenhet av systemutveckling i .NET (C#) inklusive erfarenhet av .NET 6 eller senare
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utveckla microtjänster som körs i containermiljö (Docker och Kubernetes/OpenShift)
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling av webbapplikationer i .NET
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av relationsdatabaser (ex. SQL Server)
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av stora organisationer med komplexa IT-system med många integrationspunkter
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete i Unix/Linux servermiljö
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av agil systemutveckling
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av CI/CD-flöden
* Både svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**
* Dokumenterad praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps-nära arbete i stora och komplexa Unix/Linux[1]miljöer med många utvecklingsteam samt god kunskap i shell-script
* Dokumenterad praktisk erfarenhet av att designa och konsumera REST/SOAP-tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av verktyg såsom Postman/Insomnia/SoapUI och Visual Studio.
* Erfarenhet av att dokumentera API:er med Swagger/OpenAPI.
* Behörighetshantering med JWT och OpenID.
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som Git, Bitbucket och Jira.
* Erfarenhet av Red Hat OpenShift, Tekton och ArgoCD.
* Erfarenhet av Elastic/Elastic APM och Kibana.
* Dokumenterad praktisk erfarenhet av arbete inom offentlig sektor


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 15-01-2026
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Software Engineer - Language Systems
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a
 **Software Engineer for Language Systems** 
 , you will join a team that develops innovative mobile and desktop applications in a complex, cross-platform environment. Our work is centered on improving assistive communication tools, ensuring that individuals with disabilities can effectively express themselves. You will contribute to the evolution of our language models, improve our software architecture, and work with experts in linguistics, speech-language pathology, and machine learning to refine and advance our solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Design, develop, and deploy products across multiple operating systems.
* Contribute to the development and improvement of application language models.
* Explore, evaluate, recommend, and process language data sources.
* Assist in implementing and optimizing natural language data processing tools.
* Work closely with linguists and speech-language pathologists to enhance communication technologies.
* Modularize architectural components to maximize scalability and minimize code duplication.
* Contribute to architectural and API improvements.
* Debug and analyze code issues using static analysis and platform-specific debugging tools.
* Implement clear and well-documented APIs for use in higher-level code.
* Follow and advocate for best coding practices within the team.


**What We're Looking For:**
* A B.S. in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience (1-3 years in software engineering).
* A strong background in linguistics, natural language processing (NLP), or a related field.
* Preferably 1+ years of experience working with C#, Python, and SQL.
* Proficiency in object-oriented languages such as C#, C++, Java, or Objective-C.
* Familiarity with NLP and machine learning libraries (NLTK, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch, spaCy, etc.).
* Experience working in Linux environments, particularly with a command-line interface (CLI) and shell scripting.
* Working knowledge of regular expressions.
* Prior experience with localization processes.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data management.


 If you are passionate about language, technology, and empowering individuals through communication, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: End User Computing Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
**Job Description:**
**End User Computing Engineer**
**Job Purpose**
 The End User Computing Engineer will provide operational support for our Mac and Windows endpoint management environment, policies, and applications across various business units. Their primary responsibility is to ensure that our endpoints are up-to-date, functioning optimally, and compliant with security standards. Additionally, the engineer will collaborate closely with support specialists to offer technical guidance and training.
   

  

 We seek a candidate who designs and implements an epic end-user experience through our services. Success in this role requires a high level of motivation to acquire new technical skills, a commitment to quality, and effective collaboration with team members and customers. Strong knowledge of Windows and macOS endpoint management best practices, including zero-touch provisioning, cloud identity management, process automation, and conditional access methods, is essential. Ideal candidates should also be proficient in managing Android and iOS/iPadOS devices.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Centralize the management of thousands of corporate endpoints, including PCs, Macs, iPhones, iPads, and Apple TVs.
* Implement, operate, and maintain software and configuration deployments.
* Lead projects to implement or enhance client endpoints and related systems.
* Identify patterns and areas for improvement in assigned areas by applying scripting, automation, or application packaging and deployment methodologies.
* Provide training on client endpoint solutions to teammates and other engineering and support teams.
* Continuously create, review, and manage internal documentation to ensure accuracy for support teams and product handoffs.
* Provide insightful projections and recommendations for client performance, security, and stability.
* Manage Windows endpoints using modern management tools such as Entra ID, Microsoft Configuration Manager (MCM, MEM, MEMCM, SCCM), Intune, Miradore, and/or BigFix.
* Manage Apple endpoints using modern management tools such as Jamf Pro, Apple Business Manager, and Intune.
* Monitor our on-prem infrastructure and SaaS health to prevent risks to our services.
* Develop effective documentation, tooling, and alerts to identify and address reliability risks.
* Support our endpoint management infrastructure during business hours and in an on-call rotation.


**Requirements:**
* Prior experience with Windows and macOS desktop operating systems and related software.
* Prior experience in centrally managing a Mac and PC enterprise environment.
* Prior experience with Windows and macOS imaging/provisioning, patching, and deployment.
* Prior experience with Windows and macOS application packaging and deployment.
* Prior experience with Active Directory and GPO administration.
* A solid understanding of computer security systems, applications, procedures, and techniques.
* Understanding of Mobile Device Management/Unified Endpoint Management & Declarative Device Management frameworks.
* Ability to work well in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment.


**Pluses**
* Working knowledge of Entra ID
* Prior experience with Intune
* Prior experience with Jamf Pro
* Prior experience with scripting for Windows (PowerShell, VB, etc.)
* Prior experience with scripting for macOS (Bash, Zsh, etc.)
* Working experience with fulfillment and change management workflows
* Experience with enterprise SSO (Okta and/or Entra ID Auth)
* Experience with Apple Business/School Manager workflows (SSO-federated Managed Apple Accounts, Automated Device Enrollment, Managed App Distribution, etc.)
* Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP)
* Jamf 300 certification or above (formerly known as CCA)
* MD-102: Endpoint Administrator certification
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent experience
* Experience with VDI technologies
* Experience with PowerBI
* Basic knowledge of database languages (MSSQL and MySQL)
* Experience with 802.1x-based network authentication
* Experience with managing a global print solution
* Understanding of the ITIL framework
* Passion for video games


 We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
   

  

**Our World**
 Activision Blizzard, Inc., is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
   

  

 Our ability to build immersive and innovative worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
   

  

*The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.*
 We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Expert IMS system services and enablers
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We are excited to announce an opportunity for a talented individual to join Ericsson as a Technology Specialist. This unique role offers the chance to provide technology leadership in sectors that are of strategic importance to our company. You will be instrumental in the development of innovative solutions, components, and products using cutting-edge technology. As a Technology Specialist, you will significantly contribute to the strategic planning to ensure the competitiveness of our product portfolio. This role requires a global nomination and appointment, with further details available .
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Drive technology leadership, becoming an in-house spokesperson and advisor to senior management.
* Contribute to strategic planning and ensure a competitive product portfolio through technical investigations and task force contributions.
* Align technology strategies with product and development goals, influencing Ericsson�s research activities.
* Judge and introduce new technology advances when they become mature and cost-efficient.
* Provide in-depth technical solutions for complex problems and drive the innovation process.
* Represent the company in relations with customers and educational institutions, and uphold our position as a technology leader.


**The skills you bring:**
* Product Development.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 776402
